dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god! You are not gonna believe this.

dialogue_turns.text: No, but, like, ninety-two million tenge. Like, just gone.

dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Another one. Yawn. What was the hustle this time?

dialogue_turns.text: Work visas, Host_A. To South Korea. Twenty-three people got scammed!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Work visas, Host_A. To South Korea. Twenty-three people got scammed!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Turkestan region, between 2023 and 2024, a fraudster deceived 23 victims under the pretext of arranging work visas for employment in South Korea.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh. So, people desperate for a better life. Predictable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh. So, people desperate for a better life. Predictable.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but, uh, ninety-two million. That's, that's just a huge amount of money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he got six years. Like, what does that even really mean?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he got six years. Like, what does that even really mean?

dialogue_turns.text: Well, they did say all the civil claims were satisfied. So, victims got their money back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they did say all the civil claims were satisfied. So, victims got their money back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...civil claims from all 23 victims were satisfied,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, eventually. After, like, god knows how much stress and financial ruin.

dialogue_turns.text: Still, it's, uh, some justice, right? It shows these things don't just go unpunished.

dialogue_turns.text: Or it shows people are still really, really gullible.

dialogue_turns.text: But it's not about being gullible, it's about, like, exploiting hope.

dialogue_turns.text: Whatever. Next story. Are we almost done?
